So, it was okay, and I wouldn't object to being made to stay there again, but next time I'll probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mozart59
Reviews.Content: Location one block from Union Square, perfect. We had two Imperial Club rooms which included a fantastic continental breakfast and wine beer & soft drinks with canapes 5pm - 7pm. The room my 16 & 13 year old sons shared was like a small apartment. Two queen beds. Flat screen TV's, wireless in-room internet, free access to great gym and pool. Access to the club lounge with TV & computers was fantastic. All staff were very helpful and polite. They allowed us to keep one room until 2pm as we had a late flight. Only two minor complaints. The carpet in my room two large stains on it and the A/C was a little noisy. I would stay here again a will definitely recommend it to anyone I know traveling to S.F. It is well wroth paying the extra to stay on the Imperial Club Floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: sleepi321
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July. The hotel is in a good central location, within walking distance to union square, from where we could get onto the hop on hop-off tour bus. Staff were very courteous and helpful. The lady at the concierge recommended a wonderful seafood restaurant and booked a table for us. The bathroom was big and the Gilchrist and Soames products were a nice touch. The hotel itself is very quiet. Although we were warned that the local area can become a bit shady at night, we didn't have any issues at all. However, since we were told to stay on the cautious side, I'd recommend others do too. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. It's a wonderful base to explore San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Leshaface
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to watch the Giants sweep the Dodgers the last weekend of July, beginning of August of this year. I booked this hotel through Priceline, using the 'Name Your Rate' option, and got it for $160 a night =/. This is the most expensive hotel I've ever booked through Priceline, so I wasn't too thrilled, however we did save about $60 had we have booked through the hotel itself so I was okay with that. The location couldn't be better!!! One block from all major shopping and dining experiences, made this hotel terrific! What made Hotel Nikko EVEN better, was that there was a Starbucks located in their bottom lobby!!! Ahh...so nice to get up, go downstairs and grab some great coffee to get the morning started! Rooms: Tiny! This was the smallest room I've ever stayed in...ever. The bathroom, however, was nice and spacious. Amenities: Not much...you have to pay to use their Fitness room and pay for Wireless Internet. Parking at the hotel is 50 a night, but literally right across the street is the O'Farrell/Mason parking garage, where we payed 30 a night, so definitely park there. The staff was very friendly and knowledgable about the surrounding areas, so that helped us a lot. Overall, I probably wouldn't stay here again, unless they offered a great deal on their rooms..

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at the same hotel as other reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: trexville
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko has all the charm and appearance of an airport lounge. The rooms are spacious and fairly well appointed, nothing wrong there, and for a city hotel it's surprisingly quiet in the rooms, but from top to bottom the place is dated, sterile, devoid of personality and somewhat tired looking. The place had its heyday 20 years ago it would seem. I'm shocked few other reviewers point this out. I stayed in an Imperial King room on the 24th room and had access to the 23rd floor lounge but everywhere I went, from the lounge to the Anzu restaurant, the facilities were sad. Anzu, supposedly a sushi restaurant had zero sushi when I went, mediocre service and I ended up walking outside to have dinner. I'm writing this review from my Nikko hotel room right now and to be fair, inside, the room has a different (and better) feel than about the hotel. Still for the same price (almost $300 for the Imperial King) you can find a much better place, and for another $90 or so, you stay at the Mandarin Oriental or Ritz Carlton, either which completely demolishes Hotel Nikko. If you arrive by car, it's another $55 to leave your car overnight at the hotel, a price I found kinda exorbitant. I don't find anything egregiously wrong with the hotel but I don't find anything really good about it, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels around”
Reviews.Author: rheasingh7
Reviews.Content: the imperial floor is the way to go w/hotel nikko. tons of extras that are totally worth the upgrade (gym, pool, wine/ cheese nightly, breakfast, etc.) rooms were well-sized and nicely appointed. only drawback was that we had small kids and we couldn't exchange breakfast buffet coupons for in-room service---we would have gladly paid the service charges in order to avoid the kids/ nice restaurant scene but they were otherwise accomodating so really a small matter. great views and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MacAroniSenior
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two daughters (20 and 16) for two nights. Bedrooms were clean and beds were of a good size and were comfortable. Room was spotless. Not too far to walk to Union Square and trolley lines. Would stay here again. Didn't have much need for interaction wth staff but they were friendly and helpful when the need arose.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: Most of my comments about this hotel are positive. Room was spacious, good wireless and desk for work, outstanding bath room with separate shower, very quiet, and excellent bed. I slept better at this hotel than most I stay in. The amenities were also nice, with large indoor pool and good fitness center. The staff were attentive without being overbearing. When I asked for a late check-out, even though they were full, they allowed me a couple of hours. The food was very good, although not great. People here have complained about being nickel-and-dimed, but most hotels in this area charge extra for things such as internet and parking. Overall, I think this hotel was an excellent value for the money compared to others in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Nikko made us feel like true V.I.P.'s”
Reviews.Author: coryrrrrr
Reviews.Content: I called direct and spoke with Kim at the Hotels reception who was excellent, she talked me through the hotels perks and why we should pay a little extra for one if the Imperial Rooms. I was very glad I did, we were on the top floor, beautiful views of the bay, large room. They have a great wine social from 5-7pm each night. Good wine, food, even a great variety of beer. Breakfast brunch was very good also, concierge was friendly and helpful, it was our anniversary and they had a free bottle champagne waiting in our room!! We will be going back to Hotel Nikko. Thanks to everyone who made our trip so amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: Jack1218
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights while visiting SF after a week in Lake Tahoe. The accomodations could not have been better. Centrally located near the cable cars and Union Square. The concierge did an excellent job of recommending restaurants. Would not even consider another hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable and classy!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie912
Reviews.Content: Petite Queen room, while not huge, was just the right size for us. Very comfortable beds, nice linens, sleek bathroom and good toiletries. The staff was professional yet friendly. The location can't be beat, especially if you want to attend the theatre. Close to Powell line cable car and big BART hub. Be aware that parking your car and using the valet will cost you $45/day, but there aren't any options in the area--parking is a premium there. Cafe Mason, just around the corner has awesome breakfast, served until 5PM.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: KGould46
Reviews.Content: Expected a first rate hotel, yet the experience was better than any I've had in my many stays to San Francisco. Will be staying @ the Hotel Nikko whenever I come to the City. Staff was exceptionally kind and courteous, food was superb, view from the room was wonderful as was the cleanliness and the entire facility including the pool and fitness center was superlative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDanny1
Reviews.Content: Right on Union Square and Market and Powell. Close to the F streetcar and cable cars to get to Fisherman's warf. Rental cars for day trips 1 block away. User friendly with helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “They bungled the bill and tried to make me jump through hoops to fix it!”
Reviews.Author: Stuffy33
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Nikko many times over the past several years...it used to be much nicer. I liked the pool, sauna, etc. Pool area now looking shabby and in need of some repairs, though sauna is newly re-done--but now it's much smaller. And they took away the swimsuit spinner! Also, they now charge $10 extra for use of the pool--that's new. Internet connection over $15 per day! ...and it was so slow I had to get a plug-in contrapation to make it work. Room though quiet and beds comfy was a bit shabby (nicked furniture, stained carpets). BUT the capper was their charging my guest's credit card instead of mine--when I called to have the problem rectified, I got a snotty person on the phone with poor diction, who did NOT apologize for the hotel's mistake, and furthermore proceeded to tell me that I would need to MAIL a photocopy of my photo ID before they could process any change in billing. I said UH-UH. NO. And I insisted that she charge my card then and there and process a credit for my guest. Horrible experience. I guess I will be scouting around for a new hotel in SF, I hope with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nikko knows how to make you feel super special!”
Reviews.Author: justbreathe33
Reviews.Content: This gem of a Hotel is a real destination to experience! This hotel pulls out all the stops from your room, the restaurant Anzu and the best customer service we've experienced in a very long time. The icing on the cake is the location of Hotel Nikko is right in the middle of the best San Francisco has to offer for shopping, tourism and just plain sight-seeing. Barbara & James Wade

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: sashaling
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a "petite queen" room,and just like any room in the city, it was small but unlike the others we stayed in, the bed was just about too short for my husband who is 6 foot. The bed was comfortable though and the room clean. This was the largest hotel we have stayed in and because of that it seemed very impersonal, and we missed the early evening wine gatherings many of the other hotels offered during our past stays. Probably would not stay again for the money.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed and will go back!”
Reviews.Author: stella_sl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my granddaughter on two different nights, as we took a bus tour for a two days/one night out of SFO. Both times the people at check-in were friendly, professional, smiling and eager to find ways to be of service. The concierge gave me explicit direction of the area I needed to go and the bellman looked after my granddaughter while I was getting our car. The room was big, great beds, coffee machine in the room with spacious bathroom and great amenities. Just around the corner from Union sqaure, it could not be more convenient. I am looking forward recommending it to my clients and returning again soon. Thank you Nikko!

Reviews.Title: “My husband called it our sleeping box”
Reviews.Author: skivler
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on trip advisor for this hotel. It's convenient to downtown San Francisco attractions. They charged us almost $60/day to park our car. The room was very small and felt a little chlosterphobic. The water pressure in the shower is horrible it barely dribbled out of the faucet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent to discover SanFrancisco”
Reviews.Author: VivaLaPlaya!
Reviews.Content: Overall, me and my husband, on vacation for 6 days in may in SanFrancisco, really liked this hotel, but... yes, there are a few "buts". First, the good things. The location is exceptionnal, right next to Powell station, near all the public transportation, the cable cars, the busy Market street and Union Square; it's an excellent feel of downtown life in SanFrancisco. Lots of restaurants at walking distance, shops, museums, all you may need for a urban vacation. And still, quite quiet: no noise in our room, the bed was exceptionnally comfortable, we slept like babies. The room and entire hotel were spotless, the staff very courteous, the lobby inviting. No trouble at all getting cheked in or out, maid service excellent. Good bathroom with standard facilities and nice decoration. The buffet breakfast is a little expensive (20$ each...) but very good, there is japanese traditionnal breakfast (for adventurous caucasians who want to have salmon for breakfast!). fresh fruits, yogurt, pancakes, bacons, eggs, potatoes... real croissants, good bread, real orange juice and honest coffee . Didn't try the restaurant for dinner but happy hour in the lounge restaurant was fun and cozy. Now the other side of the medal... As previously said by other reviewers, internet is NOT free and costs at least 15$ a day via AT&T Wi-Fi (or 35$ for 3 days...). You also have to pay an extra 10$ to use the pool and exercise room during your stay (you pay only once for the entire stay). And the pool, is OK, not exceptionnal; there is a kind of plastic (?) coating that gives a bizarre feel and look to the pool, the water is too shallow (maximum 5 feet deep) and warm. Could not swim: no room, too hot. Aloso, the rooms are a little small (wich i don't mind myself) , but has no drawers to put your stuff in and only one night table and reading lamp beside the bed. The TV has no HD signal (we are spoiled by ours...!), but this is an insignifiant detail, i guess... Overall we are very satisfied and would consider going back if we planned another stay in San Francisco...

Reviews.Title: “$16 / day / DEVICE for ITERNET”
Reviews.Author: ddavie
Reviews.Content: Next time I will stay at a hotel that DOESN'T cost 200+ per night and still want you to pay 16 dollars per day, per device for internet! In other words, if I stay with my wife, and we both want to have internet on our laptops and iPhones, we will have to pony up an extra 64 dollars nightly. There are no nearby wi-fi spots that I can find to use either. If you like having the internet, stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: Les521
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Nikko San Francisco and it was wonderful they are a Pet-Friendly Hotel without charging you a pet fee or deposit. My husband, myself and little doggy enjoyed the plush room and the beautiful bathroom. The location is perfect, close enough to Union Square. We had a room on the 18th floor and it was quiet. The interior of the hotel is beautiful..would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel - Rooms must not be the same quality - corrupt hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: bethesdaman
Reviews.Content: This has been so far the worst hotel that I have been to this year. I was very concerned when I waited in line and watched each check in staff member act as car salesmen. They insisted that everyone "upgrade" ranging from a "romance package", "internet package", "city view package", etc. I was amazed to see people accepting some of these sales tactics too. Basically you pay for everything at this hotel - Internet, pool, gym, business center, parking, etc. Nothing is included in your rate here. The lobby is open. However, the water feature wasn't working and appeared that it needed some major repairs. The carpets in the lobby needed to be replaced. The elevators were very, very rough - all banged up as people have stated here. In regards to checking in, I refused the upgrade and still wound up on the 20th floor with a city view. Reading through some of these reviews, the rooms must not be of the same quality. My room had two queen beds. The carpets were stained everywhere. I asked for a different room but was denied because there were no others available. I wouldn't walk on the floors without my shoes. I just couldn't believe how bad the carpets were. The furniture was all beat up - so worn that it looked like it was about to fall apart. The baseboards in the room were in terrible shape. There was at least an inch thick of dust on all the lights - especially the one above the TV. The bathroom was the only thing that was nice. It had been updated and was very nice. Bath products were a brand from London. Water pressure was strong. No complaints about the bathroom. The location is not very good. It is on the edge of a bad part of town. Be prepared to be bothered by people when entering and exiting the hotel. I saw a person get forced out of the Starbucks that is attached to the hotel lobby. Overall, my room was terrible. I was not impressed by the hotel staff because they insisted that everyone upgrade to a better room. This is not a luxury hotel by any means. Stay clear of this. If you do deiced to stay here, make sure you ask to view your room first before accepting it. Enter this hotel with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zog13
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel while at a business conference and was very satisfied. Given the price of the room it is unbeatable in value and location. I had 2 different rooms on the 21st floor (Nikko Floor, I upgraded, good choice). The first faced East (kinda a peek-a-boo view of the bay) and 2nd was North (towards Nob Hill, pee-a-boo view of Marin Headlands). Don't get the south or west, not recommended by staff, west is almost entirely blocked by the Hilton. Rooms are nice, a little bit worn but not a great deal. But nice. I've seen much worse. The showers are great: glass enclosures, great shower head, good water pressure, wish I could bring it home. Staff is very, very helpful. When I complained that a new neighbor turned the in-room stereo too loud they quickly changed my room (slight upgrade). Gym is better then average for a hotel gym. Lots of equipment, nice locker room, with spa. Pool is a little below average but OK for workouts. I didn't go to the hotel restuarant or bar, didn't look as appealing as Irish pub and all-you-can-eat Indian buffet across the street. Starbucks at street level is very convienent. Location in city is close to Union Square. That's ok, a little distance from Chinatown, Marina District, Financial districts, but the price and room make up for it. If you are going to a conference at the Moscone Center it's very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Priceline value”
Reviews.Author: lindengroves
Reviews.Content: I paid $79 per night for four nights and was disappointed when I saw that I had gotten the Nikko because of the wide range in reviews. However I was pleasantly surprised when I got there. The room was very, very small but clean, excellent bed and linens, nice compact bathroom. I was there on business so didn't spend much time in the room. Excellent location, close to everything, but the neighborhood is fairly gritty. Many (relatively) inexpensive restaurants nearby if you can dodge the bums. I looked to find fault and this is it: no bed side lamp, no chair other than desk chair despite room for one, radio had no reception, tv was slightly out of whack, no plug ins on base of desk lamp so had to crawl under the desk to plug in chargers, floor lamp came on and off on its own despite being turned off, rug was clean but stains showed, no place to set the unnecessary decorative pillows from the bed except the floor. For what I paid I found these things to be minor but it shows a lack of attention to detail I would have been extremely disappointed if I had paid the rack rate for a four star property. However, I would stay there again for the price. Public areas and staff were fine, housekeeping thorough.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: zengrl
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that I got the room at a good discount thru travelzoo so that is a big reason why I feel like I got a steal. The hotel was surprisingly clean, big, well-managed. The deluxe room was spacious and the beds were very comfortable and covered in nice linens. Nothing looked outdated. I loved the gym with the pool atrium. I read other reviews saying that it was on the border of a seedy district. I've lived in LA and NY and so I have no idea what they were talking about. Yes, a person was being arrested near the carport when we checked in at midnight but I did not blink an eye and the doorman was sure to greet us and make us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “NICE AND COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: mirka
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Nikko Hotel last weekend. Hotel is conveniently located close to Union Square shops and dining. Beds were comfy, room was very clean and staff pleasant. I would definitely stay at Hotel Nikko again. Parking at the hotel is pricey, but across the street is city parking for $28.00 a day, compare to $45 at the hotel. We walked or took cabs around town.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate from Priceline and great location....but....”
Reviews.Author: pghpgh20
Reviews.Content: We paid $60 a night for the hotel via Priceline. When we went to check in they wanted to hold $200 ($100 per night) for our stay for incidentals. I understand wanting to hold a reasonable amount, but this was excessive in my opinion. I told the clerk I understand wanting to hold for incidentals, but I never pay more than $50 (It ravel often and use Priceline most of the time). He ended up holding only $100, but if someone did not have the reserve on their card, they would be out of luck. Just be aware. The location of the hotel is great. You can easily walk to anywhere in the city- in fact we did. The room we had on the 21st floor was small, but it worked well for us. The bed and bedding was top notch. The hotel staff was also very nice. Instead of parking in the hotel garage, I would recomend paying $29 for 24hrs at the garage across from the hotel on Mason.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: johnstickman
Reviews.Content: nice place to stay downtown. good service. nice pool and gym. hotel offers upgrades online. for $50 per night got a nice sweet on 19th floor with great views and a 2 hour wine, beer and cheese reception. 1 1/2 blocks to union square. pets are welcome. we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price Great Location for a Staycation.”
Reviews.Author: cmlcampbell
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprized with this hotel. Would stay here again. Located near many of our favorite restaurants. Union Square is just a few blocks away. Close to Powell St BART station. We live in the Bay Area so this was a new hotel to explore. For a special treat we ate at the hotel restaurant, "Azusa' it was nice, the salmon was great. It was a little expensive, but not for San Francisco. Will stay there again while exploring San Francisco sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel despite the worries...”
Reviews.Author: calculus1918
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day trip to San Francisco and stayed at Hotel Nikko for 3 nights. I was definitely not looking forward to the hotel part of the journey after reading the negative reviews about the hidden charges. However, for someone to criticize the location of the hotel (3 out of 5 stars, they must not know anything about cities at all. This hotel is located right in the middle of everything, 2 blocks away from the cable cars on Powell Street, less than a 5 minute walk... It's basically the same as Time Square in terms of location. That being said, I was a little ticked to read about the $30 upgrade (we paid it anyways since my wife could not come on the trip this time and it was well worth it. It went from 260 square feet to 420 square feet and the bathroom is huge, room 1512 but the cost was high adding it to my $72 priceline winning bid plus taxes)... I thought I read somewhere that Priceline guarantees 2 beds for each bid, maybe not I guess... A hotel like this in NYC would be way over $150... There were spots on the carpet that should have been cleaned, but overall, can't compain and we are pretty picky when it comes to travel and reviews (price vs. performance is the name of the game)... No internet was also a downer, but there is the Apple Store two blocks away too :-)!!! Make sure to try out the "That's it Market" that aired "Man vs. Food," one of the best sandwich I have ever had for $8!!! Best advice I can give you if: Before you pay for the $30 upgrade, go and check out the rooms and compare it yourself!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value and great location!”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: In our first trip to CA, staying two blocks from Union Sq was very convenient for transportation and dining options. The hotel has a nice, spacious lobby decorated with lovely and discrete japanese theme. We had a priceline US80 booking for 5 nights and asked for a complimentary upgrade for partner's birthday, which was not given to us, but instead, our demand for a high floor with a view, was provided for us. Fair enough! The room is not huge, but definitely not as small as I feared from some other reviews on TA. In fact, the room and the whole hotel experience was really comfortable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Nice Super Clean Hotel is 4 stars all the way!”
Reviews.Author: GuyTraveler324
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel. Doormen constantly open the main doors, asking how they can help. Front desk staff very helpful. The hotel is immaculate. Fantastic fitness center (extra minimal charge) with steam room and sauna. Very clean. I highly recommend this place! I didn't have a car so i didn't need valet parking. Room was perfect. Wonderfully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SLeteneur
Reviews.Content: We booked this room through priceline for $75/night. We upgraded to a king room upon arrival for $20 per night and that still seemed like a small room, but it definitely worked. The bathroom was actually quite large with a separate tub and shower. The best part of this hotel is the location. It is blocks from Union Square shopping and all the public transportation we needed from the BART to the MUNI. We took the BART to and from the airport. It was $8.10 each way per person. The station was only 2 blocks from the hotel, so it was very easy and door to door took about 45 minutes. We bought a MUNI pass for the rest of our public transportation. For $20 you can buy a 3 day pass that allows you unlimited rides on all the buses and trolleys throughout the city. Otherwise, the buses are $2 one way and trolleys $5 one way. This hotel with it's location and cheap price on priceline is definitely worth staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges for Pool/Leisure/Internet”
Reviews.Author: 9x9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the fact that my husband would like the option of using the pool.We compared various hotels in the area and paid a little more because the pool and leisure facilities are listed on the hotel's description via Bookings.com. However, when you arrive you are expected to pay extra to use the pool($10 plus tax) per person(one-off) and for internet despite the fact that it seems to be free all over the city!! ($15+tax per day). It's deceptive and dishonest. If we'd know that there would be these hidden charges we would have chosen a different hotel. If they were more open about it, then we may still have chosen the hotel over others if it had compared favorably, but wouldn't have come away feeling that they were trying to rip us off. The room itself was nice and clean, but there are bigger and better rooms and service to be had in the same area (and in better areas close by). It's not a terrible hotel, but of the three hotels we stayed in during our stay this was the only one with hidden charges - the only one that charged to use internet, only one to charge for pool and leisure facilities and it was the smallest of all too.

Reviews.Title: “Nikko in SF”
Reviews.Author: wdenbest58
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with luxury rooms and excellent location in the centre of SF

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value, Good location”
Reviews.Author: NDfan2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Easter weekend. The location was just right. We took the BART from the airport and exited Powell St. station, a few blocks walk and we arrived at the hotel. (I purchased the BART tickets online and they were mailed in advance of our trip).The hotel is very close to Union Square, the cable car and trolley. The hotel is close to the sketchy Tenderloin area, so know which direction you are walking. The hotel is not especially fancy, but clean, quiet and convenient. It is true, as some of the other reviewers point out, the carpet and furniture needs refreshing. I found the staff friendly and helpful. I liked that the hotel offered, for free, the WSJ, NYT, USA Today, and local papers. For $10 per room, per stay, we had acess to a very nice gym and heated pool.I would stay here again. Also, I suggest buying a muni pass which is good for unlimited travel on buses, cable cars and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Erlapi
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I had several problems with them. Their rooms featured a shower and a bathtub. My bathtub was very dirty and I asked them to clean it. They assured me they would have cleaned it right away...they did not. The day after I asked again, they cleaned it but very poorly. Total elapsed time 3 days to get a poor cleaning job. We were lucky to have shower in our room. The steam room at the health club was out of order, but they did not mention that to me when I paid the additional $10 to get access to it. I asked the concierge about tickets availability to visit Alcatraz. She told me no tickets were available. Ten seconds later I went online with my Iphone and booked 4 tickets! The location is very good, but very noisy (traffic, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “The *worst* Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SoccerDon1981
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" and received a notification that Hotel Nikko was selected for our San Francisco hotel. I was pretty excited at the rate ($70/night). I mean, for two beds/two people - that's a steal! ...then we arrived...we were given 1 bed (even though we booked on Priceline for TWO people). The customer service clerks were complete snobs, incomplete in explaning the "fine print" in which we had no idea there would be "fine print" and they hung us out to dry. All of this, before we even finished checking in! At that point, we were not too happy that Hotel Nikko would be our home for 4 nights. (FYI, the Hilton is right across the street...) We were told, "Priceline customers are given our 'cheapest' rooms". Our great price of $70/night shot up to $110/night (due to the 2 bed "upgrade"). We found out that we had to pay for internet (yes, even wifi wasn't free), the pool and the fitness center. I also found out that they sent a request to my bank to "hold funds for incidentals" -- none of these items were brought up upon check-in. Sure, I gave my debit card to them to hold for incidentals, but they mentioned nothing about actually placing my funds ON HOLD. One thing led to another and they finally released my funds 4 days *after* I got back to Chicago from my vacation. You've got to be CRAZY to stay at Hotel Nikko. I will never stay there ever again, and I will definitely be passing on the word to my friends and family. This was the absolute worst 4-star hotel that I have ever stayed at. The person who posted (further down this page), "Hotel Nikko will nickel and dime you" had it absolutely correct. I wish I would have found this website earlier...but "Name Your Own Price" really doesn't give you an option to cancel or change your pre-selected hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: AntonioNog
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and my teenage daughter during the Spring Break. The restaurant is excellent and the free tasting wine hours from 6 to 7 pm, are delicious. My advice: Take a room in floor 24th. It is incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the ratings”
Reviews.Author: chelldeni
Reviews.Content: I agree with uwbadger22's comments and add that I selected a "pet friendly" hotel and it was anything but pet friendly or family friendly for that matter. You have to walk a few blocks to let your dog tend to the call of nature. The pet rules stated my little dog could not stay in the room unattended for any amount of time, even if she was kenneled!!! This meant I could not go out with my kids without the dog, so we ordered delivery from nearby restaurants only to get complaints from the delivery staff at how rudely they were treated by hotel staff. One driver stated the staff said, "We don't want your kind here. You don't have money." The room I was given had horrible pet stains on the carpet which I have never experienced before in a pet friendly hotel room and the furnishings looked old and damaged. In addition to other reviewer's comments about no wireless access, even in the lobby (something standard in lower end chains!), there is also no microwave, gift shop, vending or washing machine/dryer. Don't dare touch the fridge or they will charge you, as pointed out in other reviews! Parking for hotel guests is $51/night but the giant parking garage across the street offers $29 for 24-hour parking, so like the internet pricing, I am not sure why hotel guests are getting overcharged for everything. This hotel caters to businessmen and Asian guests. If you do not fall into this category and are used to staying at lower end chains pampering you with warm cookies and fragrant Bath & Body Works soaps, you probably won't like this place. Don't forget anything, because they will charge you for anything you forget that other hotels give you as a courtesy. Positives: good maid service, an excellent gym and good location for shopping/dining-assuming you don't have a pet and can actually enjoy these benefits:)

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: UWBadger22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel on Priceline and got a great deal, but overall we were disappointed. We had previously been staying at a Hilton in the financial district which was also a 4 star hotel and we had a much bigger and more comfortable room, a better view, and free wi-fi in our room. At Hotel Nikko, the room was very small, the view was of another hotel, and wi-fi would have cost us $16/day. (For $5 you can sign up for free unlimited wi-fi at the Starbucks that is located in the lobby!) Our bed was a double and when we asked about upgrading as we heard was an option from other reviews on Trip Advisor, we were told that the hotel was booked for the weekend and there were no upgrade options. The sign on the mini fridge informed us that everything was electronically monitored and if you even moved things around to accommodate leftovers, it would charge you...unless of course you called the front desk, then they'd only charge you $2 to move the things around. The bottle of water in the room was $6. If we had wanted to use the pool/fitness center we would of been charged extra. The furniture in the room seemed old and we were left wondering how this hotel has a 4 star rating. In our experience 3 to 3 1/2 star hotels seem to offer a lot more services to their guests. We are not big shoppers so the major designer stores in the neighborhood did not attract us. Our previous hotel in the financial district was a much more attractive neighborhood for us- we enjoyed being close to Chinatown and North Beach. North Beach seemed much more authentic and had many more places to eat that weren't way overpriced. We got help from the concierge twice, one time he was very helpful, the other time not so much. The thing we did appreciate about Hotel Nikko was it's proximity to Market Street where you can catch most busses and the streetcars which will take you to Fisherman's Wharf and the Ferry Building. We also liked the Starbucks in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: linasia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. It was great! We booked for 79/night on priceline, but upgraded to a king bed room. We were on the 16th floor, with views over union square area. It was quiet, clean,beds were super comfortable, and service was great. They have great room service coffee! I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money, showing its age, far better alternatives in same location.”
Reviews.Author: keywe
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room for two nights. In my opinion the stained carpet and mismatched battered furniture looked like they came from a second hand store. Bathroom shower fittings were suffering from improper installation and lack of maintenance. The advertised "city and bay views" actually had us looking directly into the rooms of the adjacent hotel. The air conditioning was noisy. My advice to a traveller is to also check that there aren't any major conferences at the time of your booking, we were later advised by a Nikko staff member that the prices were higher at this time as a result. In my opinion, the Nikko was probably the worst value for money and there are plenty of quality alternatives nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely quiet hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: pgreenld
Reviews.Content: Got this place on Priceline at an incredible price and was assigned one of the very small rooms (Petite Queen). Room was quiet, clean, well appointed, and well equipped. Service was very attentive and prompt when I needed it. Nice fitness center (extra charge of $10 for the entire stay regardless of length). While the room is small, it is certainly acceptable size for one person, and maybe even for 2 people if you don't plan to spend lots of time sitting in your room. The public spaces in this hotel are very easily accessible and are just fine to get out of your room if you need to. I did not see the bigger rooms, but I found this to be a lovely hotel, even at a higher price than I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: j57
Reviews.Content: I paid under $100 a night for this hotel through priceline, so for the reason I'm giving this place a 4 star. It's on OK hotel. The staff were very nice, the room was clean but basic and very small. My room had a bed and a TV and that's about it, and was about 12 ft by 12 ft. The hotel needs a facelift, particularly the rooms. For the price, this is a bargin, but I personally would not pay much more than what I did to stay here. Also, a word of caution. I did not know this until after I checked-in, but this hotel is near the "Tenderloin" area of San Fran, which is the most crime ridden part of the city. So do not venture too far from the hotel at night in the direction away from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dallastraveler099
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent! All of the staff at the hotel were so gracious,the room was beautiful,we stayed on the 16th floor in a corner king size room with an amazing view! We would stay there again in a min.! Be prepared for parking fees at the hotel,we stayed over night and it was $50.00

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Location, Friendly Service, Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Sproketz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while visiting the city for show and a weekend getaway. We saw a good rate on Hotels dot com ($100), so I called the hotel directly. They matched the internet rate and offered us an upgrade to a larger, king room for $10 more. The hotel is in a great/safe location near Union Square and BART. The receptionist was very friendly upon arrival, the lobby was nice and quiet. Our room was nicely decorated and appointed with a large flat panel TV, in-room coffee & tea, and lots of expensive goodies in the mini-bar. The large bathroom was really nice--large tub and separate shower. The size of the King Deluxe room was about average. (Not too small -- We were glad we upgraded.) We didn't use the gym, pool, or restaurant. We rode BART in to the city to aviod the crazy parking fee. Our only complaints would be that the shower tile could have been cleaned better and the furniture & walls are showing some wear. Free wi-fi would have been nice. Overall, a really good stay and a solid 4 star choice. We would definately stay at the Nikko again if we found a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo torn!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom3under6
Reviews.Content: First, I would say that I am not a high class traveler. I am perfectly happy staying at an average hotel as long as they are clean and safe. This hotel met those criteria. The rooms were definately worn. The furniture had multiple scratches, dings and dents. The walls had some scratches or bits of torn wall paper. The fabric chairs had stains on them...in multiple locations; so did the carpet. It wasn't horrible and if you could look past the imperfections, it was just fine. They were clean rooms (besides the stains) and had totally adequate bathrooms. The location of the hotel is perfect. I traveled with two of my girlfriends for a mommy's weekend and we had a blast. The staff was very helpful and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants and how to get around the area. Would I stay here again? Yes. Would my friends who like the better things in life? Probably not. I think it was a great value for the money and location. One of the best parts of the hotel is the spa/pool area. You have to pay $10 (per room for your entire stay) for access, but the cost was totally reasonable and a great treat. There is a seperate locker room for women and men and each had their own steam room and sauna. The pool area wasn't spectacular, but it was empty and we enjoyed the hot tub. Oh, and there is a great little Irish pub across the street. They have live music and a great atmosphere. They have dueling pianos several nights of the week. All in all, we had a great time in San Francisco and the hotel met our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Amenities, Pleasant Service, Needs Some TLC”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: The Nikko San Francisco is well located a few blocks from Union Square. It is easily accessible by public transportation from all major points, including SFO, which is just 25 minutes away by BART. The hotel is decidedly 1980's in its appearance and decor. The spectacular lobby is spacious and quiet, a nice oasis in a bustling neighborhood. Despite numerous complaints on this website about small rooms and lousy service, we were warmly greeted and offered an upgrade for $20 above our Priceline rate of $89. We were given a corner room, on a high floor, with stunning floor to ceiling views of the Financial District and Nob Hill. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had been upgraded. The furnishings are all tattered, walls are scuffed, and there is visible wear and tear just about everywhere, including the spacious gym and pool area. Even the lobby furniture and elevator doors are all banged up. It's not pretty, but you don't really mind it much when you are in a very quiet, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Past Its Prime!”
Reviews.Author: VWMAYER
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at the Nikko--about five years ago--the hotel was beautifully appointed. This time, I booked 2 rooms on Priceline, and was disappointed to find that the rooms had QUEEN beds, rather than King beds. The room decor was very, very worn--with a ratty tatty bedskirt, scratched furniture, stained carpet and NO artwork. What's more, there was a $10 charge for the health club and a ridiculous fee for internet service. Oh yeah, the concierge was rude and very uninformed about the restaurants in San Francisco and parking was $60 a night! The best thing going for this hotel is that it's in a GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Not so big deal”
Reviews.Author: rmiro
Reviews.Content: I will preface that I booked this on Priceline (sorry TravelAdvisor). Went to check in and was informed I would only be getting 1 queen sized bed. A room with another bed would be $30 +tax more than my winning bid. Excuse me. I was traveling with two kids. Thanks a lot. Sheets were very uncomfortable (starched?). Service mediocre. Location is very good. Parking is a joke $52. Save yourself $37 and park across the street at the public parking garage. 5:30 pm to 9:30 am: $15. Twenty four hour parking $29.00 and change. Not that impressed by the Nikko scratched furniture. Okay it had a big tub liked that. No free internet in this day and age. Nickel and diming guests. I prefer Holiday Inn Express. But beyond that blah!

Reviews.Title: “Service malfunctions at the Hotel Nikko”
Reviews.Author: seattleu78
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on 12/26 for 1 night. I love the Rrazz room, so we always wanted to stay in the hotel (cool marble lobby). However, there were enough problems at every step that I may not stay there again - really not up to snuff. First, the reception clerk Charlene asked at the very beginning of the check in if it is ok if she takes calls while helping us (no it's not ok, but I have to choose to be a complainer or a victim 2 minutes after arriving at your hotel?! Great.) She took 2 calls while "helping" us and it took 10 minutes to check in. Unstaffed apparently with lousy customer service training. She also never asked for our name, just our credit card and drivers license. Where's the attempt at personal attention and civility? Would it help them if they just assigned me a barcode? Anzu restaurant has ok - not fantastic - food, but the decor is dated and it looks like a conference room trying hard to look like a nice restaurant. Service was good though. The closet doors in the room were broken and falling off the rails and the air vent was broken and rattled all night. Where's the maintenance crew? Worst still, the cleaning maid knocked on the door at 10am (check out is at 11) and asked if we were leaving and were we done with the room (answer - no I am still in it therefore I am not done with it and you can't clean it yet). 10 minutes later when we did leave the room she asked again if we were checking out and could she go in now. What is huge rush? It was no big deal, but it contibuted to the sense we got from the hotel that they just don't care about their guests oerall comfort and feeling welcome. For $50 a night more the W is a better bet, or perhaps the Hilton for $25/night less.

Reviews.Title: “Home in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Nes1745
Reviews.Content: Excellent location...Beautiful, modern hotel...Good service..Rooms are beautiful, Nice view from the room..nicer view from upper level rooms.. We had a technical problem with TV, they offered for an upgrade club room... Beds are very compartable...only thing to complain , parking is very expansive..$52 daily..must be normal for SFO...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the expense - Dirty room, Stains, Scratched Furniture”
Reviews.Author: ccarolyn
Reviews.Content: We flew into SF for a extended family gathering in San Fran and the wine country. I have stayed at hotels all over the world and expected a clean well appointed room from this Japanese hotel chain. The lobby was impressive but if you really looked at everything it was chipped, scratched and in dire need of repair and updating. The room we were showed to had light colored carpeting which was extensively stained, the lamp shades were dirty and stained, and the furniture was all banged up. I asked to have a room change and they explained that the hotel was going through renovations and we would be moved to a room which had completed the renovation project. Well, TWO rooms later I just gave up and decided that this was going to be the condition of all rooms. They had tried to UPSELL us at checkin to the two or three top floors which were 'Nikko' floors for $89+/night. I didn't realize that unless you upgrade - you would get stuck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our Choice”
Reviews.Author: VKail
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, very close to BART station, cable car lines and Union Square. The lobby and hotel is well presented and creates an appealing and safe first impression. The king deluxe rooms is a good size. Higher floors have a nice skyline view. Front desk staff and concierge were very courteous and helpful. Pool is large and workout area is nice. We found the hotel and room quiet. Didn't try the hotel restaurants as their are so many great restaurants in the area. Lots of great places for breakfast. The carpets in the room were a bit dirty and the bed was good but nothing special. Other than that nothing but positives to say. We got a good rate through a travel agency and felt it was a good value compared to other similar level properities in the area. This was a very functional and comfortable hotel. For our first trip to SF it didn't let us down and made for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emma027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikko hotel for 4 nights, it was our second time in San Fran and we were not disapointed with this hotel, if we return again we would defitely stay here. Upon arrival the great bell service took our bags and guided us to reception. Reception/lobby are very impressive, huge, bright modern space with lots seating. Lovely reception staff checked us in, we were asked if we would like access to the pool/fitness area as this was only $10.00 for the entire stay (for two people for 4 nights) we said yes. Hotel is large but there are plenty of lifts so you are never waiting very long. Yes the standard rooms are quite small but we did not feel cramped at all, they are well decorated and very clean. The bed was very comfortable with lots of blankets and pillows. Room had a large flat screen TV (with plenty of channels), desk area and lots of storage space. Bathroom was lovely, very modern, shower was really good, the bath was small/shallow but I find this is standard in most US hotels. Great tolietires and coffee making facilitires which are replenished daily. They also give you the usual iron/ironing board and hairdryer. Our room had a great view over San Fran and the Bay. Daily house keeping was very good, new towels, toiletries, coffee every day The pool/fitness area is well worth the $10.00 fee, because they charge people the place is pretty much empty. The reception area and changing rooms (which have a sauna and steam room) look brand new. We didn’t use the gym but it looked good with all the equipment you could need. Pool area consists of a resonable sized pool and a jacuzzi, the only downside of the pool is its so shallow in some areas my partner (at 6ft 2in) had trouble swimming in it! It is a very rleaxing area which is just what you need after a day in busy San Fran. We didn’t eat in the resturant but it looked very nice, we used the lobby bar a few times and were very impressed, great bar service, lots of comfprtable seating, very relaxing atmosphere. We used the business centre once, the internet is quite expensive but then it always is in a hotel. Added bonuses were an ATM within the hotel and a Starbucks just off the entrance area. The hotel is also right opposite the main Car Hire companies on O’Farrell Street (Dollar/Thifty etc). Location couldn’t have been better, just off Union Square with easy access to great shopping/resturanets and the cable cars. I much prefer to stay in this area than the very touristy area of Fishermans Wharf. We had a slight problem at check out as one of our bar bills had been added twice but it was very quickly sorted out. The only compliant I had was with the conceige desk, the lady manning this desk was very unhelpful and acted like she was doing us a favour helping us. She kept my partner waiting for about 5 minutes while she finished what she was doing on her computer and only helped him after he said it was a quick question! Surely their top priority should be the guests? I would have given the hotel 5 out of 5 if it wasn’t for this, as conceige is a very important thing when you are in a new city.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless at the nikko”
Reviews.Author: bearfan86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on a Wednesday. Rooms were clean but small. Hotel is near everything. Cable cars, Powell bart, shopping galore, wonderful restuarants. Returned to hotel for the evening around 9. We were awakened by loud fire alarm and intercom message that a fire alarm went off and they were looking into the situation. Then we heard fire trucks around the hotel. Since I fell asleep with wet hair I got up to dry my hair got dressed and got my belongings and waited for instructions. They never called. My husband called and they said every thing was okay. No apology, no nothing. Finally went back to sleep around 11. The next morning the front desk, concierge, all acted like it was no big deal. Contacted the director of operations. "Oh I'll look into it. " Checked out and charged $15 for internet service. Funny we don't have a computer. They looked us over to make sure we didn't before adjusting the charges. Stay at the Hilton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, food, staff and everything else”
Reviews.Author: DonGoesDigital
Reviews.Content: Took BART from San Francisco airport for $8.10 and walked 4 mintues from Powell St. to the hotel. The location is amazing. Very short walk to cable car, a mall, MOMA (Muesum of Modern Art). What is not close is easy to get to by BART or cab. Staff was great. TV experience not great. Flat panel, but not many channels, nothing HI Def. 5 business travelers with me all agreed that Anzu restaurant was amazing. I'll stay here every time I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Weekend For Two at The Nikko”
Reviews.Author: phairston
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to attend the recent engagement of Ashford & Simpson at the Nikko. Since I had previously been a guest of the Nikko and was impressed with the excellent accomodations and service, I suggested that we spend the night so that we could really enjoy the event and not drive home Saturday night after the show. We also made a reservation for Sunday brunch. Of course, the show was fabulous, brunch was delicious and hotel was still as wonderful as I remembered. My boyfriend was so pleased that he is planning several more visits for us in the next few months. This makes me a very happy lady.

Reviews.Title: “centrale”
Reviews.Author: enricoca
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, clean and quiet. Gym very old, ridicolous pool. All the bars were closed. Central position, guys efficient and professional, not warm...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ofeliasa
Reviews.Content: this is not the chic hotel they advertise. it is over priced and understaffed. the lobby is very cold and uninviting. the rooms are the size of closets and they charge over 240.00. they nickel and dime you to death, have to pay extra for the internet connection in your room. not enough lighting. no honor bar. no help in the business center, photocopies cost over a dollar. staff is just as cold and unhelpful. I recommend the Hilton it is just next, or the Marriott just a couple of blocks away. they have people all over the hotel warmly greeting you and happy to assist you and copies there are either free- Marriott or .15 cents at the Hilton. Oh yeah and it costs extra to use the fitness center. This hotel is not worth the high price they command at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Our first time at Nikko -- but we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: cbblades
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-night stay via Hotwire as our first try ever with the online booking site. It was our "big citiy" interlude between a week in Napa/Mendocino and a trip to Lake Tahoe. When we arrived -- earlier than check-in, time I might add -- we were treated cordially and efficiently by the front desk personnel. She confiremd our reservation and let us know what kind of room we had -- a "queen" room. She let us know that we could upgrade for $20/night to a more spacious "king" room. This was a no-brainer, given the low, low rate we'd secured on hotwire. Our king room turned out to be a corner room on the 12th floor -- full of light streaming in from two directions, and high enough above our neighbor buildings that there was no need to close the drapes! Everything exuded luxe -- this, after a week in some too-idiosyncratic B&Bs! Staff was friendly throughout -- from front desk, to concierge, to bar, to cleaning staff encountered in the halls. Bed was terrific, the roomy bath a pleasure. Great location -- a block off Union Square. When I reported items missing in the mini-bar, so as not to be charged for them, housekeeping said they'd take care of it. When the items appeared on our bill, I simply told the front desk they weren't our charges and they instantly removed the charges. Our stay made us big fans of Nikko Hotels. We are big fans of cabaret, and the Nikko has a room with headliners. Sorry we didin't get a chance to sample it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for 1 person”
Reviews.Author: mrolfes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and in a good location for a tourist, Union Square. The room was nice but really small, and not much closet space. I was by myself in the room so it was fine, but I don't know how more than one person stays in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The bar has a good happy our which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad trip in San Francisco at Hotel Nikko”
Reviews.Author: Sweetflowers
Reviews.Content: I had hoped that Hotel Nikko would be a nicer hotel. I booked my room months in advance so I could spend the night before running in the San Francisco Women's Marathon. My room was very small with no view. The bathroom and furniture were nice, but the rug was tattered and stained, walls had dirty marks, and the room smelled musty. The bed was comfortable with nice sheets and pillows. The worst part was that someone started pounding on the door of my hotel room at 2 am. I tried to ignore it, but the knocking continued. I finally got up and checked the peephole and saw a woman outside who appeared to be crying with her face buried in her hands. I yelled through the door to go away, that she had the wrong room. The woman then tried to engage in a conversation to try to get me to open the door. I wasn't going to participate in that BS so again I yelled through to door for her to go away. She then started screaming that I was a horrible person who doesn't care if someone is getting raped or murdered outside my door. Yeah, as if that makes me want to open a stranger in the middle of the night. I immediately called the front desk to have security come check things out. I never heard anything back from the hotel/security. I asked the front desk a couple different times about the incident, but no one seemed to know anything and didn't seem to particularly care. I had a hard time getting any sleep the rest of the night as I realized that someone was trying to set me up to rob me in my hotel room in the middle of the night. I will never go back to this hotel, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-Friendly and Pleasant Staff in Prime Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: kawh
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through a site that had the word "cheapo" in its name-- so that should tell you something about the level of room we got--- probably the worst and smallest. Still, it was clean and bright and had a good tv and decent desk. They are pet friendly--- and by that i mean that they do not charge a bogus nonrefundable deposit of any kind. (though we did sign a paper stating that we would give them all our worldly possessions if the dog did any damage.) I think there is a weight limit on pets that they accept. The location could not be better-- right at the downtown area, and not too far into the tenderloin. There are several non-hotel parking choices on surrounding blocks for about $25 which includes the huge city tax. While our room was tiny and i must fault them for having no lights near enough to the bed to turn them off without getting up... the bed was very cozy and the air conditioning was quiet and very effective. As others have said, the staff is very kind and, though we were in a very inexpensive room, they treated us as if we were valued guests. The Nikko has an awkward approach to the lobby-- but once there, it is lovely and peaceful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for San Fran touring”
Reviews.Author: Slepster
Reviews.Content: We had a "Nikko Floor" room, which I believe was slightly larger than standard room. Was fine for 4 of us. Came with free wifi, a great breakfast buffet and access to the health club and pool. Service was fine and location was great. Tops for convenience, with a Starbucks and Enterprise car rental right in the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location near Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: fierycale
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nikko is located in the heart of the Union Square area. It's a short (and flat) 2 block walk from the Powell/Market BART station, making it very easy to get in and out of from the SFO or Oakland airports. It is also near the Powell cable car stop, which is a "must do" tourist attraction. It is also a short walk to prime shopping and restaurants. The hotel is quite large and airy in the lobby area. However, the room sizes can vary quite a bit in size. King bed rooms tend to be cozier than those with 2 double beds, which are more spacious to accommodate the beds. Room service at the hotel is also quite good, and I've always found the staff to be courteous and prompt. As a travel agent with Eden Exploration, I would definitely recommend the Hotel Nikko to clients for their leisure or business trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the place!”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: Overall we very much liked this hotel. We felt the location was a great starting point for most areas in the city. Now after being to SF I feel like anywhere you stay in the city would be fine also considering how small SF is anyway. The way I read other reviews I really expected to show up and this be very Japanese styled, but I really didn’t find it that way. Yes it had an influence but if someone dropped me in there and didn’t tell me anything I wouldn’t have guessed Japan Airlines owned the place. Check in No problems at all and we arrived pretty late, around 11:30pm. The front desk clerk was very friendly and efficient. Room Good sized room, 1030 I believe, with a king bed, desk, dresser, fridge and chair. We also had a large window to see some of the city from our side of the hotel. Bed I liked the bed but the pillows were horrible. They were so soft and gave no support at all. It was so bad my wife went and got a towel to put under the pillow for extra support. Bathroom It was huge and very nice. Our had a full tub and shower. Never had a problem with hot water and I also liked the pressure. There was more then enough room in there for 2 of us to be getting ready at once. Fridge Small mini bar fridge in room. I wanted to open it to put in drinks but I didn’t want to set off the sensor to charge me. TV Nice big flat screen TV with a bunch of channels. They also had a few Asian language channels. Internet Was pay. I ended up just using my cell and I got good coverage with Verizon in my room the whole time. Checkout Easy and quick. They gave us the bill right away and we were on our way. Overall We liked and place and got a great rate on Priceline. I even had a rental car one day and I was able to find a parking spot outside the hotel. I wouldn’t bet on that often.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Keithomurphy
Reviews.Content: Though Hotel Nikko shows some wrinkles, the hotel made up for its blemishes with a phenomenal and courteous staff. I never felt like I was imposing on anyone at the hotel. The concierge, the attendant at the Imperial Lounge, and the waitresses/servers at ANZU were helpful and engaging without being invasive. I was offered an upgrade to a suite which was nice, though I could not afford it. I can't say enough about the people at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not too nice...”
Reviews.Author: oaktownjlove
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko was nice, but not quite as spectacular as I'd imagined/hoped as a splurge for a local event. As a Bay Area resident, when I pay for a hotel I want it to be over the top. Nikko satisfies, but doesn't leave one wanting more...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: felicebezri
Reviews.Content: A quick note to express how delighted I was to stay at the Nikko Hotel. I travel extensively for work. I basically live in hotels and I am always annoyed by un-smiling faces at the desk or by desk staff that treat you as if they were giving you charity. I was very satisified with the way I and my clients were greeted at the Nikko Hotel by Teresa. She was so friendly and accomodating. GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nikko is a great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: jkc804
Reviews.Content: We booked the Nikko for the pool and it turned out to be a great choice all around. The room was very nice - upscale (see pics) - clean and a decent size for a city. The location of the hotel was nice - near union sq. No it's NOT near the waterfront but close to the cable cars, busses, trolleys etc. LOTS of places to eat close by (Try Sears for breakfast). Also Union Sq is a hopping place - lots of bars, clubs, shopping. We went into more upscale hotels nearby but you would pay a lot more for them too. One hint - DON'T get the cable car at the end of the line - get it a block up - no lines!. The restaurant inside the Nikko had good food. A little pricey but good. We LOVED using the whirlpool tub at the pool after a long day of sightseeing and hiking the hills of San Fran. It refreshed us for the next day. There are a lot of homeless people around the hotel / union square area. One concierge wasn't too friendly and didn't seem super knowledgeable about the area but others were good. The front desk was ALWAYS friendly and nice and helpful. And we got in 9:30 AM and they had a room for us. Booking on Expedia I thought they'd make us wait til 3. No view though. We wonder if we booked direct would we have been on the side with city views? We had a building to look at. OH - The on site car rental was a great deal - cheaper then parking at the hotel if you rent from the airport. We took a shuttle to the hotel and rented as needed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel staff and classy setting helped make our stay memorable”
Reviews.Author: m3Chicago
Reviews.Content: I have many positive points about our four-night stay! We appreciated the friendly staff throughout the hotel: the front desk, concierge, maids and bellmen. We slept well in the fluffy queen bed. The building is quiet. Although our room was close to the elevator, no hallway noise bothered us. The rooms were soundproof; we weren't disturbed by any talking or plumbing noise either. Our room on the 21st floor was a bit cramped, but it had a good view. The health club is a good deal, costing only $10 for our entire stay. The indoor swimming pool is shallow, but the exercise room and changing area are spacious and well equipped. Our trip was enhanced by the excellent service we received, the hotel's classy interior, and we liked being close to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Groupeventplanner
Reviews.Content: Booked my large group at Hotel Nikko for the weekend. It was a lovely stay. The hotel treated each of my guests well, and even provided extras to me (the event planner). It is so easy to walk or travel anywhere from here, about 3 short blocks from the Powell Street Station, and hubby and I easily walked to the Alcatraz Tours (down Market to the Embarcadero, very flat) and to a baseball game (Market to 3rd, thanks to Trip Advisor Forum!). San Francisco is such a unique city, and Hotel Nikko is unique as well. It has an Asain theme, but I felt that it was understated and very elegant. The buffet breakfast in ANZO was excellent too. I recommend for a special stay. BTW, took the group to Teatro Zinzanni. It was good, though maybe a bit longer than it needed to be. Good value for the money. Great performers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireHolidayGoer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko was in good condition, with clean rooms and an excellent location. Ideally placed for Union Square and a short walk to the tram or bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: sharpnup
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night before departing on road trip following day. Lovely Hotel with all ammeneties. Flat screen tv, Very comfortable bed, Centrally located and reasonably priced at $100/night (from memory booked in advance) This hotel has all that you require for a great stay- Starbucks located by front door, Very good conceirge service, walking distance to all major attractions-Union Square, China Town, downtown shops & car hire. Tried to stay again apon my return to San Francisco unfortunately booked up! Should have known given the quality and friendliness of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: aron73
Reviews.Content: Great room, great amenities. This is a beautifully appointed hotel with a gorgeous lobby. The staff is professional and friendly. Did not care for the hotel sushi bar/restaurant. I would recommend "going out" if you want to find good, affordable sushi. Wonderful stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “This was a very pleasant place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ManCGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Imperial Club room, on the next-to-top floor. The room was extremely comfortable and clean, with nice views of San Francisco. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable, and the room had nice lighting and chairs. The bathroom was big with a good shower. The Imperial floor has a lounge with large windows from which one can see San Francisco harbor, and in which continental breakfast is served, as well as an afternoon wine/beer and fruit and cheese party. We got coffee in the morning, which was very good coffee, and had a glass of wine in the afternoon. The room also came with two tickets for the buffet breakfast in the Anzu restaurant. There is a standard American breakfast, and a Japanese breakfast, both of which were very good. The location is close to the Powell Street BART station, and Union Square, and many attractions in San Francisco are within walking distance. The front desk personnel, and the bell captain were very friendly and helpful. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It was a most accomodating hotel, the service terrific”
Reviews.Author: sweatypie
Reviews.Content: I have been to many hotels in my travels, and have never stayed at a more accomodating hotel as the Nikko. Everyone was so helpful. It was most rewarding place to stay at. There were 3 especially helpul. Michiele, Annette and Rick were always ready to help us whether it was arranging a tour, or just answering general questions, they took the time to make sure that all our questions were answered in a polite professional way. These 3 persons should be commended the way they performed their duties

Reviews.Title: “It was probably pretty posh.... 5 years ago.”
Reviews.Author: LeftRock
Reviews.Content: OK, I got a deal. It was a busy weekend, and I got a deal. Great location minus the wrong turn I made latenight into the bowls of "The Tenderloin"... avoid that. Basic room, wasnt spending enough time there to pay for the multiple "upgrade" offers. It was clean, nothing fancy, great bed. Black paint around the mirror and a new counter top does NOT qualify as "renos" though. Very dated, including the carpet seams letting go... its time for the Nikko to spend some money for that "4star" rating. The staff was decent, but previous reviews were spot on... LEAVE LOTS OF TIME TO CHECK IN AND OUT! I would still recommend the place, just dont expect the real deal 4star.

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake”
Reviews.Author: mona100
Reviews.Content: I wish I had taken the negative comments about this hotel more seriously. We liked the location of the hotel but will not stay here again. There are so many other good hotels in the area, so don't make our mistake. We got a Imperial Club room to make sure it's not too small. We got there around 2:15. They told us the room is not ready but it will definitely be ready by 3. They got our cell phone number and told us they'll call us when the room is ready. We went to the concierge lounge and waited for their call which never happened. Finally, around 3:15 we went back to the desk to see what happened. As soon as the receptionist saw us, she remembered that we have been waiting for her call. Only then she checked to see if our room is available. They still didn't have any rooms available even thought it was after their official check in time. She asked us if we want to upgrade to a suite for $65 more?!!! Any other hotel, at this point would've said we'll upgrade your room since it's our fault that your room is not ready. We already had paid so much for the imperial level room and didn't want to pay any more so decided to just wait. This was just the beginning of their horrible service. That night when I was leaving the gym, I saw an Exit sign next to a door and by mistake thought that's the actual exit. Since there were no other signs there, I had no idea that this door gets locked behind you and you can't open it with your hotel key. I was stuck in a small hallway that led to the Fire exit. I banged at the door and tried to get their attention to open the door. Luckily, I had my cell phone so I called my husband. He called the desk and asked them to open the door for me. I waited for quite sometime and kept on knocking on the door but nobody showed up. Eventually one of the guests who was passing by was nice and opened the door for me. The hotel security never bothered to even call me to see if I'm out!! When we complained about the fact that they never called us to confirm if I got out of there, they were so unprofessional and rude. I thought they would apologize and try to fix future problems minimally by adding a sign that would say "This door locks behind you", but I guess even that is a lot to expect at Hotel Nikko!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the Hotel Nikko San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: mriddle
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nikko is the perfect "City" hotel in which to stay. The staff is Awesome! Not to mention the location of the hotel; walking distance to great shopping, nightlife and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Elsask
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel from tripadvisor. Close to shopping, buses. We walked to Wharf and took bus back. Walk to Chinatown, Italian area and on down to the Wharf. San Francisco very safe for women traveling. Try Johnny Folley's Thurs, Fri or Sat after 9:30. Great piano bar. Mad Piano's very entertaining. We went to Asia SF. Great food, fun and entertainment. Be prepared to walk. Lots to see and do. Do rent bikes and do the Golden Gate Bridge trip. Return by ferry. We went to Francines on the Wharf great view and lovely dinner. This hotel has entertainment Lorna Luft was there when we were. She did a great show.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly stylish, elegant and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Mishkamitten
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two nights of our holiday, having booked through Hotwire and got a very good deal. We were offered an upgrade for 'fantastic views and a bigger room'. Well, the room wasn't the biggest we saw in San Francisco, but the views were fantastic - we had a corner room which overlooked downtown San Francisco with distant glimpses of the Bay between other buildings. We loved the cool, marbled elegance of the bathroom, the huge flat screen TV and the enormous bed with its pillow-topped mattress and forest of pillows of different sizes and colours. Shame about the powdered milk and the charge for internet access, but all the four star hotels we stayed in were similar in this respect! Staff were very efficient and friendly. We didn't eat in, as it was expensive, but the location is so good you can find hundreds of places to eat more cheaply and there are internet cafes around if you don't want to pay the charges. Loved it and would go back if the chance arose.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Offagainareyou
Reviews.Content: Good location a few minutes walk from Union Square, Cable Car and BART Powell Street Station. Room average size for this rating and reasonably fitted out but looking a little tired. View from 17th floor overlooking city OK with a tiny glimpse of the Bay Bridge. Maybe better views higher up and looking towards the north. Concierge and front desk staff extremely helpful and polite. No tea and coffee making facilities in rooms which is irritating but Starbucks downstairs with entry from lower foyer. Mini bar in room fully stocked so no room for your stuff - all electronically tagged so move anything and it gets charged to your account - very very irritating. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value nice rooms however staff not so great”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: we booked two rooms in this hotel for us and our two young children (10 and 8) having asked to be close to each other ;however when we arrived the people at the reception were overwhelmed and although we had our reservation confirming our request they put us in 2 rooms on a different floor .Reception and concierge facilities were absolutely below average The rooms however were very nice and clean and noisefree and after all we were ok with the kids . breakfast is very nice and the overall price also was very good. one big minus the guy in the hotel bar was very unfriendly and the bar lacked charm.

Reviews.Title: “Hectic, But A Good Choice For Downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SheriffBart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikko on the last night of our San Francisco trip. I normally don't stay at large "business conference" style hotels, but I found a great rate (187/night) on a Club Floor room so thought I'd give it a try. All in all it was a nice stay that was a cut above a chain hotel Check in was prompt and efficient (at the time we were there at least; later on in the night there were some LONG lines), and the same lovely girl who checked us in also printed out boarding passes for us at the end of her long shift. I thought the Club Floor would have some exclusivity to it, but I think almost everyone in the hotel was staying on those floors!
